isis.stitle: T 444E Diesel Engine Diagnostics (NAVPAK) (1997) - SECTION 3.5: ELECTRONIC CONTROL SYSTEM DIAGNOSTICS, ACCELERATOR PEDAL POSITION SENSOR/IVS SWITCH (APS/IVS) - VEHICLE RETARDER (VRE) - CIRCUIT FUNCTIONS

svcproc.title: CIRCUIT FUNCTIONS
svcproc.para:
On engines/vehicles equipped with an engine brake or a transmission retarder the VRE (Vehicle Retarder Circuit) circuit's function is to control the relay or solenoids that turn the brake or retarder on and off. This circuit has many applications and can be wired in many configurations. The applicable wiring diagram for the correct application must be used for troubleshooting this circuit.Refer to the wiring diagrams ( Figures 3.111, 3.112, 3.113, 3.114 and 3.115
). The diagram on the following page is generic and only describes the general function of this circuit. Chassis pin # 47 (VRE) is normally used to turn a relay or solenoid on and off by grounding the coil circuit of the relay. Chassis Pin# 15 (EB) is either used as an ON/OFF switch for the engine brake or as a power source for the engine brake relay depending upon application.
